John answered for himself in a clear and convincing manner, and with such simplicity and candor that his words had a powerful effect. His hearers were astonished at his wisdom and eloquence. But the more convincing his testimony, the deeper was the hatred of his opposers. The emperor Domitian was filled with rage. He could neither 
                                                                           570
dispute the reasoning of Christ's faithful advocate, nor match the power that attended his utterance of truth;  yet he determined that he would silence his voice.
